custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see that our 'Favorite Team' is selected on the right
and we will see that the appropriate calendar for the 'Favorite Team' is open on the right only on initial fresh install app launch

and Select Team selector automatically opened
and no schedule is loaded in the main section

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will go back in time when the user scrolls up and forward in time if the user scrolls down

custom_steps_separated.expected:

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the color of the cells for Home Games will reflect the Team in question appropriately

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then when we look at our device's normal Calendar we will see the schedule for the team we've selected

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the MiLB.com menu button in the center and taps on the Team Schedules and taps on any team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then we will see the current month's home games clear
and the previous month's home games clouded over
and the next month's home games clouded over

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the MiLB.com menu button and taps on the Team Schedules cell and taps on any team and taps on a date where there is a game in preview
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought into gameday for that team.

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps the MiLB.com menu button in the top left and taps on the Team Schedules cell and taps on a team with a double header and taps on a the date of a double header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the game detail view with 2 buttons on top, one for each game
and when the user taps on either of the buttons then the corresponding gameday page should load

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on the MiLB.com menu button on the top left and taps on the Team Schedules cell and then taps on the team that has completed a double header
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see no score for either game on date; it will just say Doubleheader
and when the date is tapped there will be the scores of both games with the corresponding W or L at the top
and when either score is tapped the corresponding winning and losing pitcher will load
and if the wrap button is tapped the corresponding gameday wrap will load

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps the MiLB.com menu button and taps on the Team Schedules cell and then taps on a team that has had a postponed game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will not see a score on the date of the postponed game
AND the user will see Postponed in the game cell
